output.conclusion: By completing this course, you've gained a strong foundation in UI/UX design principles and practical skills. You are now equipped to create user-centered designs that are both aesthetically pleasing and highly functional. Continue to practice and explore new trends to further enhance your expertise.
output.introduction: Welcome to the Intermediate UI/UX Design course! This course builds upon your existing knowledge of UI/UX principles and delves deeper into advanced techniques and methodologies. We'll explore topics such as advanced prototyping, usability testing, design systems, and accessibility, enabling you to create sophisticated and user-centered designs.

chapters.description: Explore advanced prototyping tools and techniques, including micro-interactions, animations, and conditional logic. Learn how to create realistic and interactive prototypes for user testing and stakeholder feedback.

Hands-on practice using Figma for advanced prototyping, focusing on variables, components, and interactive components. Learn how to create reusable and dynamic prototypes that can be easily updated and maintained.

Delve into various usability testing methodologies, including moderated and unmoderated testing, remote testing, and A/B testing. Learn how to choose the appropriate method for different project needs and budgets.

Learn how to analyze usability test data, identify key insights, and translate them into actionable design recommendations. Explore techniques for prioritizing issues and communicating findings to stakeholders.
Understand the principles behind design systems and their importance in creating consistent and scalable user experiences. Learn how to define design tokens, components, and patterns.

chapters.chapterTitle: Building and Maintaining a Design System
chapters.description: Explore the process of building and maintaining a design system, including documentation, version control, and governance. Learn how to ensure that the design system remains up-to-date and relevant.

Gain a comprehensive understanding of accessibility standards and guidelines, including WCAG (Web Content Accessibility Guidelines). Learn how to design for users with disabilities, including visual, auditory, motor, and cognitive impairments.
Explore techniques for testing and auditing the accessibility of your designs, including using automated tools and conducting manual reviews. Learn how to identify and fix accessibility issues.

Learn the core principles of UI animation, including timing, easing, and choreography. Understand how to use animation to enhance usability, provide feedback, and create a more engaging user experience.

Explore different techniques for implementing UI animations, including CSS animations, JavaScript animations, and animation libraries. Learn how to optimize animations for performance and accessibility.
